cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating WNW through the southwestern Atlantic, then bending northwest toward the southeastern U.S. coastline (North Carolina/South Carolina) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern coast of North Carolina (near Wilmington/Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from northern Florida through Virginia, greatest risk from South Carolina northward
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Wednesday night–Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the northeast Florida beaches due to long-period swells
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain, locally higher, late Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning immediately and persisting through the week
